audio_description: Hello friends, we are at Chef Madhu's Kitchen — your Chef Martin. Today at Chef Madhu’s Kitchen, we are going to see a superb dish: Dindigul Thalappakatti Chicken Biryani. You all know how famous this biryani is in Tamil Nadu.

audio_description: There are two secrets in this recipe. The first one is these bay leaves and cardamoms — roast them slowly, make it into a powder and use it. That’s the first secret. The second one, if you look at it...

audio_description: ...this has its own secret and specialty. I'll tell you many such things at home — watch till the end. Ingredients needed for Thalappakatti Biryani: 1 kg seeraga samba rice, 1 kg country chicken, 50g onions, small shallots...

audio_description: ...half a bunch of coriander leaves, 3 bay leaves, 3 cinnamon sticks, 10 cloves, 5g cardamom, 1 tbsp fennel seeds, 1 tbsp coriander powder, 1 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 200g curd, 50g ghee...

audio_description: To make the biryani masala powder: use about 10–15 cardamoms, 3 cinnamon sticks — for other biryanis just 1 stick is enough, but here we need 3, because Dindigul Biryani...

audio_description: No oil should be used here. Roast it slowly like this. No other ingredients are needed. This is a simple masala. Roast it nicely — see how it’s turning out — then we'll powder it well.

audio_description: Now we’ll powder it. No need to grind it too much — just a light coarse powder will do. If it's powdered too much, the taste will be too strong. This level of coarse grinding is enough.

audio_description: Next is the base paste for Dindigul Thalappakatti Biryani. Take 150g of shallots, 10 green chilies, 80g of ginger, 80g of garlic. We’ll grind this into a raw paste.

audio_description: I didn’t peel the garlic; I used it whole with the skin, because the skin gives a unique aroma. I’ve added mint leaves to it — that aroma is crucial.
